column4: I installed pidgin and my nautilus-send-to menu was uninstalled in the process due to some bug. Is there an updated package for the nautilus-send-to feature for pidgin and feisty as in gutsy?
I am confused are you using feisty or gutsy?
Andrew: Feisty
Did you build from source?
You could have just got the deb package from getdeb.com
Andrew: No I used synaptic. It unistalled gaim, gaim-data and nautilus-send-to
Andrew: I searched ubuntu packages website and nautilus-send-to with pidgin support is only available for gutsy
So you installed a Gutsy package on Feisty by modifying your sources list?
I was just wondering if anyone came across such a package for feisty

Andrew: Ok I think I wasn't very clear :-) I installed pidgin in feisty. Synaptic said that in order to install pidgin it needed to remove gaim, gaim data and nautilus-send-to. I am just wondering how I can install nautilus-send-to again without removing pidgin.
Andrew: The only nautilus-send-to package I found with pidgin support instead of gaim was for gutsy and thats no good since I am using feisty
I am just wondering how you installed pidgin because it isn't avaliable in the feisty repository.
!offtopic arcad3
Got it from linux mint repos
After all linux mint its just ubuntu with a couple of addons :-)
If you remove the packages you installed would your system return to normal? Then try giving the getdeb package for ubuntu a try?
Yes if I remove pidgin I can install nautilus-send-to just fine and have my menu back. I will try getdeb as well. Thnx!
hang on i'll get you the link
No need got it
Google is my friend :-)
ok
Thnx
